website_summaries.verdict: A hand strap that provides extra support and security while you are holding your camera.
pros: Ergonomic shape is comfortable to use
While wearing this strap you can still access all your camera controls easily
Easy to slip your hand into the strap for use
Helps support your hand and wrist when you are shooting over long periods of time
Does not get in the way of a tripod mount
cons: This strap is not as adjustable as it could be in order to fit different camera and hand sizes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Strap
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best strap available. It truly fits like a glove. I use it with the XT3 and while the XT3 is a very lightweight camera, it gives me extra security when hand holding it. There is an extra strap that you can attach to prevent it from ever slipping out of your hand. Very useful if you are on some sort of ledge or standing over water where one drop could mean the end of your investment. Only problem was that Amazon Warehouse didn't send me any of the necessary hardware to attach it. Being as awesome as Amazon is, they compensated me with no issues so I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Buy the belt clip and plate.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. It gets the neck strap off the camera and provides a great way to secure the camera while moving through the field. Buy the belt clip and plate so you can secure the camera while ascending or descending on trails, stairs, or other obstacles. Sounds like a no brainer but skimping here equates to arm/wrist fatige and less than stable hobbling over obstacles. Pro Tip: If you have medium to large hands. Angle the strap towards the lens and curl/choke up like you're dialing in the shutter speed. Then lock down the straps position. This will ensure you have enough room to articulate quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Design With One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: The strap is really comfortable while providing a safe way to carry my 5D MIII. However, when I put the camera into my camera bag, the plastic tab (at arrow in picture) that attaches the strap to the camera often slips out of the flattened islet on my camera. A small strap keeps the camera from complete separation, but with the tab out of position the Spider Pro Hand Strap is loose. An engineering change to that tab attachment is needed to make this strap perfect. Despite this problem, I really like this strap and use it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a neck strap!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this wrist strap for my camera when it was first introduced by Spider. I was on a waiting list for a couple months to receive it. I love it! No more carrying heavy cameras around my neck. The wrist strap is adjustable and fits like a glove. It perfectly affixes the camera to my hand in a shooting positon that is comfortable all day. It's like the camera becomes a natural extension for my hand. No more neck aches. I bought additional units from amazon for my other cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great strap, do need to force to get it installed
customer_reviews.text: great strap for my Canon 6DMkII. I did have to use a bit of force to get it in through the hole (and wiggled it a bit). When I first installed it, I had the plastic brace going parallel to the camera (straight across). It made holding it kind of awkward. I noticed for DSLRs it said to angle it, so I gave it a bit of an angle and I was able to hold it better (thumb and index finger placements in their spots). Overall great strap. I worry about the thin leather security strap, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G Pieknik

customer_reviews.title: Very secure and good looking!
customer_reviews.text: A very serious hand strap! Extremely pleased with the purchase. I’ve had various handstraps over the years and they’ve all been flimsy in comparison. I also love the leather and the security of this strap. Works great with my spider holster but I’d be very happy with it even without that connection. Best I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.author: DianneN

customer_reviews.title: How to install on an A7III/RIII
customer_reviews.text: This is how to install it onto a Sony A7 body. Put the plastic part over the eyelet "upside down" and then wrap the securing strap around from the top to underneath and thread it through the eylet to secure the plastic part to the camera. Then wrap the securing strap back up top and thread the access strap into the provided dongle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: I love this hand strap except for 2 issues i have ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Professional Photographer and often shoot 9-14 hour large scale events. I carry 2 cameras on my Spider Hip holster (SUPER LOVE) and shoot very quick. I love this hand strap except for 2 issues i have had with it. the small strap that is used to secure it tightly around the wrist loosens quite often and is hard to keep real snug. Another issue I have is that going from hip to hand takes several seconds getting this thing all strapped on. I have found i have missed a few shots due to this. Other than that, it is very well made and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: L.E.M Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why I was waiting to buy it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I was waiting to buy it for so long. I have not been using camera's neck strap for years. Kind of pointless for a full frame camera with lens attached. Took me few days to adjust the strap properly (particular test was not to align plastic in parallel with camera body back, but rather at some angle). I have fairly big hands, and I am still able to use all buttons on the back of Canon 5D Mk III with my right thumb (only after adjusting the strap properly).
customer_reviews.author: Igor C

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Tried to install this on a Nikon d750 with a right angle plate. What a disaster. Took it off after trying to get it to work for an hour. It always interfered with something and it was not worth the hassle. Would have returned but of course the little springs are next to impossible to use without spreading them apart which then made the whole thing non returnable. Waste of time, money and effort. Save yourself the hassle and do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: cvb

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! This is our second Spider Holster. Had the holster on one camera and decided it worked so well we wanted it for our second camera. We use these on a Canon 6D and 60D. Works well on both. As one reviewer commented, it does have a tendency to loosen up after using it for awhile. In our case I believe that is partly due to the way we "stuff" it down in our camera case, but it's very easy to tighten and didn't stop us from purchasing one for our second camera.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Fits Sony a7R III
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to popular belief, this does in fact fit a Sony a7R III mirrorless camera, which took me roughly the same amount of time to mount as it did my 5D Mark III. I have tried both Spider-Pro and Spider-Light with this camera, and I can say with certainty that the Spider-Pro feels a lot more secure as it doesn't rely on a loose plastic hinge. My only complaint is the tight squeeze on the battery / SD card doors. They are both accessible, but may require a few extra seconds to insert / remove. Otherwise, it's still a relatively comfy fit and I am able to access all functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz​on Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hand strap for keeping your camera sucure while on the move.
customer_reviews.text: Spider products are pricey, but worth it in my opinion. The quality of materials and construction is top notch. I purchased this to use with my DSLR camera and 70-200 f2.8 lens while walking around shooting sporting events. I works great and gives me piece of mind I won't accidently drop it, or have it slip out of my sweaty hands here in HOT Arizona.
customer_reviews.author: AZShutterbug

customer_reviews.title: Works great. If you need to pack it in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you need to pack it in a tight bag the strap is a bit rigid (which is a good thing) but it does make packing down a little bit of a challenge. For what I do it's pretty nice, spider holsters waist straps are great with this. No more neck slings!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nakayama

customer_reviews.title: fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Use it with Nikon topend bodies without any issues. Carry it all day. I can't imagine it could get any better. Only minor nit picky item is that it uses a hex screw to screw into the bottom plate and it sometimes comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: whatever

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have one on every DSLR that I own. Doesn't matter if you are walking or climbing or whatever, the camera will stay in your hand even if your completely open your grip on it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Bob

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit a woman's hand no matter how tightly I adjust it. Tried it with a battery grip on my camera, so it's not the camera size. I really wanted to love it. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Comes loose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the SpiderPro Single Camera Holster System, and no matter how tight I tighten it down this strap always gets loose. It takes about 4 hours if use every time before I start to notice it needs to be adjusted again.
customer_reviews.author: CASEY

customer_reviews.title: it is a wonderful product, but for me it didn't work to ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, it is a wonderful product, but for me it didn't work to well, I'm not quite an nimble as I use to be, so I gave it to my son who is also an amateur photographer and he absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Popi1

customer_reviews.title: It is also evident that they have been fine tuning their first product for the better as well
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. It is also evident that they have been fine tuning their first product for the better as well. I have one of the original variants and the newer ones utilize nicer hardware.
customer_reviews.author: BigDon

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, made with quality materials.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the Spider-Pro holster. It exceeded my expectations for quality and comfort. I can’t imagine not having it on the camera now. Time and use will tell on the durability of the plastic portion of the strap, but overall I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adds Comfort, Eliminates Fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I like the added comfort and security of the Spider-Pro hand strap. It also helps distribute the camera weight which combats fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lott

customer_reviews.title: Nice Change
customer_reviews.text: Went from a Rapid camera strap to a belt clip and a hand strap. Neck no longer hurts and this product allows for a steady grip and have never been concerned that I will drop the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Redmond

customer_reviews.title: I love this hand strap.
customer_reviews.text: I love, Love, LOVE this hand strap. It fits around the knuckles and, even without the smaller second piece, it lets me hold my hand comfortably while the camera sits where I want it. It's not just about preventing drops; it makes using the camera much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best Handstrap period !
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a fan of hand straps but none of them felt comfortable when it came to making adjustments to the settings while in the strap. This hand strap meets all my needs. Very comfortable and absolutely love the locking strap. Highly recommend this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Boyle

customer_reviews.title: I love this strap
customer_reviews.text: I love this strap, make it easier to use my spider holster. I have a grip on my camera and it works. The only problem I have is that if I am holding it for too long my hand and wrist start to hurt, but that could be because I have a heave camera lens combination, not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Defenderofnight

customer_reviews.title: Canon photographers, you want this hand strap!
customer_reviews.text: THis is an amazing hand strap, has a sturdy band that wraps around your wrist to prevent the camera from dropping! Love it! Feels great!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S.

customer_reviews.title: The best DSLR hand strap I've ever tried
customer_reviews.text: The best DSLR hand strap I've ever tried. Comfortable with small to large lenses. Makes hiking with a DSLR comfortable and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Louise S.

customer_reviews.title: Best camera strap
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase, using on née camera. Comfort and sturdiness are prime benefits. Can walk around for several hours with camera ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE.
customer_reviews.text: I like this strap a lot. I use this all the time. It is a little awkward to use with my controls on A6000.
customer_reviews.author: Border Traveller

customer_reviews.title: It goes back in easily, but having to constantly do this gets annoying ...
customer_reviews.text: The part that connects to my Canon 6D constantly comes loose after transporting in my bag. It goes back in easily, but having to constantly do this gets annoying after a while. It definitely works well though!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Brown

customer_reviews.title: 3 for the comfort when the hand it's strapped in ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 for the comfort when the hand it's strapped in. 2 for the design. The handle makes getting to memory card/media slot quite inconvenient on Nikons. If you foresee a need to quickly swap cards, forgo this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Arseny M

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Design is worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Goes so well with my Spider gear I already own. It is double/triple the price of what's out there but the quality of the product is very evident. You get what you pay for. I love it. Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dahey

customer_reviews.title: I love this hand strap
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand strap! I originally bought this to use with Canon 1dX Mii, because I wanted the added stability to this big camera body. I loved it so much I ended up buying one for my Canon 5d M3 too.
customer_reviews.author: lvandyke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and with the strap the camera fits ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hand perfectly. Easy to use and with the strap the camera fits securely and wont fall. Better than any other hand straps I've used.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Should've bought this 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Took it with me on a Peru trip. Very glad I had this. I now feel confident holding the camera without dropping it in precarious situations. The only downside about having a hand strap is when you show pictures to other people and they pull on the camera with your hand still in the strap, it'll twist your wrist. But this is no complaint about the Spider Holster, wish I had bought this 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Amazing Features
customer_reviews.text: There are some pretty amazing features on this strap the SpiderPro Hand Strap is cut in a curve so that it really wraps around your hand and doesn’t get in the way of your finger movement easy access to the battery and memory card slots on the camera This is honestly the most comfortable camera strap I have ever used! I use the Spider Pro camera System Camera Holster and the Spider Pro Large Lens Case Pouch Bag as well. Everyone here at LFactorPhotography uses the SP Hand strap and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Buff Dog

customer_reviews.title: Spyder Hand Strap!
customer_reviews.text: I love this strap! Best ever! Spend the money, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey O

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip...
customer_reviews.text: I makes me feel secure about my camera. It is comfortable but takes some getting used to. Arrived as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable strap. Very nice when walking around
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable strap. Very nice when walking around. Looks better than a neck strap! I've had this around my wrist for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brent William

customer_reviews.title: Spider Camera Holster SpiderPro Hand Strap
customer_reviews.text: One of the best camera straps I have found. And, as expected, it goes perfectly with the Spider Camera Holster setup.
customer_reviews.author: joanlizard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I was crawling through cattails this winter getting shots of animals, never came off my hand.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and provides a secure grip when carrying the camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and provides a secure grip when carrying the camera around in your hand. Works fine for shooting horizontal shots. Rather awkward for vertical shots--at least on my Canon 550D. I've gone back to using my less sophisticated and much less expensive Optic strap.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: More convenient than a neck strap for me
customer_reviews.text: Much better feel than a neck strap for me. Very secure and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Empty

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically comfortable strap
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic hand strap. The quality is great and it is supremely comfortable. I especially like the way it curves which makes it easy to get your hand in and out of it. This is the second one of these I've bought now and I can't see myself buying anything else in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kamal

customer_reviews.title: Secure grip with one hand
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very comfortable and gives you a secure grip. Handy in situations where you hold your camera with one hand. Works on its own or with any release plate. Cons: Attaching and detaching the strap to the camera is a bit complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Janos

customer_reviews.title: This is a photographers must have.
customer_reviews.text: This is a photographers must have. Easy to use. Will never take them off the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Elysabeth Kapas

customer_reviews.title: SpiderPro Camera Strap Exceeds Expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a fan of hand straps for a DSLR, but since moving to the Spider Holster, I needed something to secure my camera(s) while shooting. (They're perfectly secure moving while in the holster) This strap is the perfect compliment to the Spider Holster. It is comfortable, extremely adjustable, and simply feels like its part of the camera rather than something simply slapped on to give added support. I'm thoroughly enjoying the SpiderPro Hand Strap on both of my cameras and I will likely purchase a third for my backup camera since I don't plan on ever taking them off my two primary cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Snow

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works as described. You don't have to remove the strap to access the memory cards or battery on my Nikon, a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: Brett M. Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made, except I wish the part of the strap that goes underneath felt more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Surfn Sun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Camera stays secure without have to have it around your neck. Easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Golf Nut

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the best hand strap ever....buy one, you will love it
customer_reviews.author: doug1408

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Product came with everything I needed to set it up with my camera. Instruction were found online easily. It's very sturdy and seems very safe. My hands are naturally small so I love how there's a second wrap around the wrist for extra protection from dropping it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like to carry the camera with this strap
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings. I have had shoulder straps for years. But at weddings I use 2-3 bodies and I now use a double holster. I like to carry the camera with this strap, but as far as shooting, it may take some getting used to. it needs to be adjusted exactly to your hand, Too loose, and its uncomfortable, too tight, and it is hard to adjust controls. I'm still getting used to it, but is made of high quality. My only drawback is, I don't like that it slightly obstructs the sd/cf memory cards while changing. Thus 4 stars not 5
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: good quality. My Camera was safe with this strap ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, good quality. My Camera was safe with this strap around my hands. I used it for the first time in Toronto Canada, all day, with the Spider Holster at the Caribana Celebrations. I recommend this to every photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Superb Hand Strap
customer_reviews.text: My first reaction was slightly negative. It seemed over-engineered and a bit complicated. Then, I put it on my new Sony A7Rii. Wow! This is a great hand-strap. Very comfortable. Secure. I will no qualms leaning over a cliff with the strap firmly holding the camera to my hand. And it's great the way it mounts under the tripod plate so that it never has to leave the camera. The curved design is important and it pulls the strap closer to the wrist. It has a clip-on wrist strap for extra security but I won't be using it. Doesn't seem necessary and a little fiddly to get on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Peter Walker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Can be used with my Manfrotto tripod plate, it is light and totally adjustable. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: John Kogle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought I liked my previous grip but I'll never use another brand than this. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: It works better on the Canon because it's a bigger camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Spider Hand Strap, the first was for my Canon 5d3, the second is for a Nikon D750. It works better on the Canon because it's a bigger camera. On the Nikon, it's very difficult to remove the battery, you have to take the strap off or at least loosen it. That's why I knock it down a star. It's extremely comfortable and I love using it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana E. Lundin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I feel very secure using this strap on my Canon 6D, even with my 70-200 attached. Package came promptly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Christman

customer_reviews.title: ... You'll have to try it to believe just how comfortable and secure it is
customer_reviews.text: The picture doesn't do it justice - You'll have to try it to believe just how comfortable and secure it is. I also purchased the Spider Plate along with it though i am not using the holster (yet). Best Hand Strap I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy without worries.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I can reach and se alll commands, except the dial in nikon 7200, but totally acceptble.
customer_reviews.author: Rilker Frota Cavalcante

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it is built with good material
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it is built with good material. Pretty adjustable and very comfortable in the hand. Camera feels very secure as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Loo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I have bought for my camera {canon 60D} fist like a glove
customer_reviews.author: cindy patin

customer_reviews.title: If you have a DSLR, ditch the strap and switch to SPIDER-PRO!!!
customer_reviews.text: SPIDER HOLSTERS ROCK! I used to use sling straps, shoulder straps, traditional wrist straps, no strap. Then I found the spider holster. Actually a friends wedding photographer was using it and I had to give it a try. I'm not going back. When I heard spider released a new wrist strap I had to try it too. LOVE IT! Permanently attached to the camera! Not taking this thing off or the holster off for years!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR SMALLER CAMERA BODIES LIKE SONY a&R III
customer_reviews.text: Excellent with my Canon 5D Mk III & IV. Horrible on my Sony a7R III. you guys really need to put a little more thought into smaller camera bodies. I was sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice strap, very flexible and strong. can access all the buttons easily. Strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay Vyas

customer_reviews.title: Camera Security and Added Flexibility
customer_reviews.text: This strap is very well designed. It's comfortable to wear and makes the camera steady without as tight a grip. It lets me totally release my thumb's grip on the camera so I can work some settings without worry. It attaches to my Canon 5dm2 (with battery grip) in a nice balanced way. Since I never use a neck strap, this adds a nice bit of security when carrying my heavy camera around all day at events.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: FAST DELIVERY
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast delivery, very happy with how it fits on my canon 5d mark3
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera hand strap I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a photographer for 30 years and this is the best most comfortable hand strap I have ever used. Its adjustable and takes the fatigue out of carrying your camera for extended time. I just got back from 3 weeks in Italy and used this with a Nikon D750. I took over 6000 photo's and this strap was awesome! No hand fatigue, highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: J Sully

customer_reviews.title: Great hand strap!
customer_reviews.text: Having tried various hand straps, this is the most comfortable and functional one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: well done at Spyder
customer_reviews.text: good design - quality materials - plenty of adjustment for individual choices - all day comfort - you can pay $12 for look alike straps and think, well its ok, but if only it was, did, had - or you can pay more for the Spyder strap and think this is great, and it has all the did,s was, and had,s
customer_reviews.author: happyharry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this hand /wrist strap! As a long time user of a cheaper hand strap, I thought I would try this Spider Strap based on my experience with their holster. This is a winner, and worth the money! Works well with my D90 in camera armor with a 18-300mm Nikon lens. Very comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cabrio

customer_reviews.title: The leather looks and feels good and is comfortable to hold for long periods
customer_reviews.text: This hand strap does everything it says it will. It makes holding the camera feel very secure. The leather looks and feels good and is comfortable to hold for long periods. All of the controls are easy to reach. My only problem is that I still have an old tripod without a quick release plate, so I have to remove the hand strap to use my tripod. I guess I'll be in the market for a new tripod soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Best hand grip ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best hand grip I have ever bought. It is expensive compared to the competition but it outshines them convincingly. It adjusts to the size of your hand well and when attached still gives you access to your battery and card compartments. The build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: KKR

customer_reviews.title: Great strap. Conforms nicely to the back of the hand.
customer_reviews.text: Love this strap. Feels comfortable and secure. Easy to adjust. Spider products are high quality and I would highly recommend this product. It's pricier than other generic hand straps but the way it sits on the back of the hand makes this superior.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wicklund

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I hoped it would be...
customer_reviews.text: Clearly a well-made product, but when fitted on my Nikon D610, the position of my index finger is not very comfortable when pressing the shutter button.The camera feels comfortable in the hand, through the strap...until I have to press the button, it them becomes less comfortable. That said, maybe the problem is with my hand! After all, you can't please all of the people, all of the time!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B Cargill

customer_reviews.title: Very good, just not perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: This works very well when I'm just using one camera at a shoot. No neck strap to get in the way of things. Didn't give it 5 stars because it's not perfect for my D800. It may work better with other brands, models.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and comfortable grip holster
customer_reviews.text: Excellent handle for my D810/vertical grip and heavy lens !! Immediately ordered a 2nd one for my pro photographer daughter as well .
customer_reviews.author: Serge A.

customer_reviews.title: I found the enclosed instructions a little "Ikea like, " and quit after a half hour
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap for use with my Canon 5Ds. I agree with most of what other people have said in terms of comfort and fit. On the 5Ds I am able to access the battery and card with the strap on, but some diddling is required with the card. I gave it 4 stars instead of five because some assembly is required. I found the enclosed instructions a little "Ikea like," and quit after a half hour. The next day I went on their website and followed the video on attaching the strap and was done in ten minutes. If you buy the strap, head straight to the video and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: joseph R. Schlauch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Most comfortable strap I've ever used...even with a heavy camera (Nikon D810) and lens (Nikkor 24-70 f/2.8).
customer_reviews.author: Mharveyww1

customer_reviews.title: This one is by far the best, most secure
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several over the years. This one is by far the best, most secure, and most comfortable. Top Notch!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Vinyl

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Amazing. Amazing!!!! The quality is incredible. It was a breeze to put on and completely changes my shooting game. Shooting long weddings always had my hands cramping at the end of the day! Now, shooting is a breeze and I don't ever feel the need to put my camera down to rest! I recommend this over and over!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: there was no instructions on the proper way to run ...
customer_reviews.text: there was no instructions on the proper way to run the strap so that it will not come undone and drop your camera
customer_reviews.author: Schrade Tactical Pen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but I don't recommend it. Lower quality than I thought I'd get for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is okay, but having seen, installed, and used it, I wouldn't buy it or recommend it. Seems over priced for what you get and the connections to the camera are a bit cumbersome and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, sturdy. Except for price which is on the higher side, its a great product. Fits on Nikon very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rama Katta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand strap! It's well made and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Imtoorich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! And it better be given the price :)
customer_reviews.author: MichelleR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love how secure and easy it makes carrying my heavy camera. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kapp

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic strap that really fits
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic strap that really fits. Shot all day, all week and hand rested well when camera hanging down. Room to use index finger on shutter for once. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Wegner

customer_reviews.title: but makes carrying a heavier camera so much more comfortable than a neck strap
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to attach, but makes carrying a heavier camera so much more comfortable than a neck strap!
customer_reviews.author: Curt Janka

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this strap, it's great to not have a strap around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awsome hand strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product and I was simply AMAZED! Still going to get one. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: john herber

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon AH-4 hand strap feels a lot more comfortable and secure
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced. Just buy the D-ring from Spider and use the hand strap of your choice. The Nikon AH-4 hand strap feels a lot more comfortable and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for what it is. It's a strap. On top of that, the little plastic piece that holds on your camera seems weak. I'm just waiting for it to break. I would rather have shoulder straps. Although not 100% uncomfortable, it's not perfect. I like how you can adjust it though based on your hand size. I don't like the face that it's an allen wrench connection.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: One size does NOT fit all!!
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work on the new small cameras (designed to mimic the older design of a 35mm film camera). They are just too small, and this HOLSTER is just too large and bulky. It does NOT "fit all."
customer_reviews.author: night owl

customer_reviews.title: Satisified
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisified with product makes carring and using much easier
customer_reviews.author: Elwood F Johnson

product_meta.title: Spider Camera Holster Spider-Pro Hand Strap, Black
product_meta.description: Never miss another photo struggling with a floppy wrist strap. Try the Black SpiderPro Hand Strap and experience real comfort and security while shooting. The unique design works with DSLR cameras with or without a battery grip. Attached to the strap lug and the tripod connection, the hand strap can be attached with Spider Plates, tripod quick release plates or the included hardware. The strap's curved S-shape and optional wrist strap make your camera feel almost as though it was an extension of your arm. The ergonomic shape is designed to allow easy access to the battery door and memory card slots. While it is optional, the wrist strap provides additional support and security. The foam padding and leather construction provide both comfort and optimal hand positioning for manipulating camera controls. In addition, with repeated use, the leather and padding will conform to your hand for a custom fit and all-day comfort.
feature_bullets: Includes 1 SpiderPro Hand Strap, 1 Hardware Kit and 1 Hex Wrench and is recommended for use with SpiderPro SCS (SKU 100) and SpiderPro DCS (SKU 120)
Curved S-shape, adjustable size to fit your hand and optional wrist strap make your camera feel like an extension of your arm and put your hand in a perfect shooting position
Ergonomic shape and design allows for easy access to rear camera controls, the battery door and memory card slots
Foam padding and genuine leather construction provide both comfort and optimal hand positioning for manipulating camera controls
Added support for DSLR's with long lenses and compatible with battery grips and any tripod or Spider plate
